_exec_summary.SummaryText:
SCS Refrigerated Services is committed to the safety of its employees. SCS has also gone to great lengths to ensure the safety of the surrounding community by developing an extensive emergency action plan. There are specific instructions for various types of incidents listed in the plan. Our engineers have received 24-hour HAZWOPER training and one-day annual refresher training and all employees have attended annual awareness training. This training ensures that our employees are familiar with evacuation routes and procedures in the event of a release. Evacuation drills have been conducted to ensure that employees know what actions to take in an emergency. The EAP has been coordinated with the Regional Fire Authority. The Regional Fire Authority will be responsible for coordination with other local authorities in the case of off-site evacuations. Visitors to the site are required to check in and are informed of the ammonia hazard and the evacuation procedure.

The SCS Algona facility is located at 501 10th Street North, Algona, WA 98001. This facility is a frozen food and cold storage facility where both receiving and distribution of food products occurs on a daily basis. There is 24,081 pounds of ammonia contained within the refrigeration system. There is also anhydrous ammonia at the site. This facility is covered by and complies with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration Process Safety Standard.

The Five Year Accident History (per 40CFRA?68.155(e) review verifies that no accidental releases have occurred.

The Emergency Action Plan (EAP), as prescribed under the EPAs Risk Management Program 40 CFR Part 68.95 addresses the fundamental steps to be taken in response to an ammonia release. The Emergency Action Plan describes situations where public safety (fire and police) would need to be notified and where evacuations may be needed. The RMP coordinator is responsible for conducting an annual review of the EAP.

This executive summary does not mention a

ny details of the off-site consequence analysis as requested in the recent changes made to the five-year resubmittal procedure. Such information can be obtained directly from SCS Refrigerated Services for those who would have a legitimate need for that information.

SCS Refrigerated Services has developed and implemented a detailed preventive maintenance program designed to prevent ammonia releases. Frequent inspections and Standard Operating Procedures and the most significant methods used in the preventive maintenance program.
